Authors:
Xueren Cao, Xiangming Xu, Haiyan Che, Jonathan S West,
Daquan Luo
Title:
Eight Colletotrichum species, including a novel species, are
associated with areca palm anthracnose in Hainan, China
Abstract:
Colletotrichum is one of the most important genera of
plant pathogenic fungi that affect numerous plant species, particularly
tropical and subtropical crops and fruit trees. In this study,
forty-three cultures of Colletotrichum were isolated from areca palm
leaves with anthracnose symptoms in eleven areca palm plantations in
eight counties in Hainan, China. The isolates were characterized based
on morphological characters, phylogenetic analysis of six loci (ITS,
ACT, CHS-1, GAPDH, TUB2 and ApMat) and pathogenicity tests. Eight
Colletotrichum species were delemeted, of which five previously known
species (C. cordylinicola, C. fructicola, C. gloeosporioides, C.
siamense and C. tropicale), an unidentified species of Colletotrichum
and a new species, C. arecicola, in the gloeosporioides species complex
and C. karstii in the boninense species complex. Colletotrichum siamense
was the most common species associated with areca palm in Hainan,
followed by C. arecicola. Pathogenicity test showed that all species
could cause anthracnose symptoms on areca palm leaves but isolates from
the gloeosporioides species complex caused larger lesions than isolates
from the boninense species complex. Further research is needed to
understand the epidemiology of these pathogenic species on areca palm in
order to develop management strategies.
